author: kedos25.eth
content: Other chains such as Cardano or Tron use dPoS. There are delegates which create pools for users to deposit their tokens. They are way less decentralized than real PoS chains. PoS chains such as Ethereum (after the merge), Solana and Avalanche uses PoS. However, requirements for validators on Solana/Avalanche are really high (hardware requirements and token requirements) so there are way less than on the Ethereum beaconchain. On the beaconchain are currently 268,675 active validators and the number is growing. The main difference between Ethereum PoS and other PoS chains are the lower requirements for running a validator, hence the decentralization is way better. There could be also differences in the PoS algorithm itself, but my technical understanding is not good enough to grasp themðŸ˜…
